meanings.definition: Relating to the production of sound
meanings.sent1: The phonatory process involves creating different sounds.
meanings.sent2: Her phonatory abilities allowed her to sing beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The phonatory skills of the parrot amazed everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: His phonatory talents were like a symphony to the ears of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The phonatory nature of the instrument made it perfect for music.

meanings.sent1: The phonatory device emitted a loud beep when activated.
meanings.sent2: The phonatory function of the machine was impressive.
meanings.sent3: The phonatory toy kept the children entertained for hours.
meanings.sent4: Her phonatory voice echoed through the empty hallways.
meanings.sent5: The phonatory nature of the bell made it easy to locate.

meanings.definition: Involving the vocal cords in speech production
meanings.sent1: The phonatory exercises helped strengthen her vocal cords.
meanings.sent2: His phonatory issues required medical attention.
meanings.sent3: The phonatory challenge of the play made the actors nervous.
meanings.sent4: Her phonatory performance on stage was flawless.
meanings.sent5: The phonatory strain on his voice was evident after the long speech.
